sections.MISSION:
Comanche, 1st Squadron, 2d Cavalry Regiment conducts Urban Rifle Marksmanship Qualification and stress shoot on 07 OCT 2024 at RG 211 to maintain proficiency on the M4 and prepare for Team and Squad Live Fire Exercises.
Commander’s
sections.PURPOSE: of this range is to provide Soldiers an opportunity to conduct refresher training on their primary weapon system and prepare for Team and Squad Live Fire Exercises.
sections.END STATE:
Soldiers conduct refresher training and successfully complete the URM qualification and stress shoot.
Training Objectives
TC 3-22.9 and TC 3-22.249/ Urban Rifle Marksmanship Firing Stance, Movement techniques, Aiming / Engagement Techniques, Point of Aim, Trigger Manipulation, Fire Commands, Ready Positions, Rules of Arms Safety, Weapon Safety status and Weapon Control Status.

Checkpoint Breakdown
• Soldiers will run from CP 1 (The Tower) to CP 2
• At CP 1 Soldiers will throw sandbags over five feet high engineer tape, then continue to CP 3
• At CP 3 Soldiers will carry two water cans to CP 4
• At CP 4 Soldiers will drag a skedco, weighing 180 lbs 50 meters then proceed to CP 5
• At CP 5 Soldiers will low crawl, high crawl, and 3-5 second rush based on the rates of fire the lane safety calls out, then continue to CP 6.
• At CP 6 Soldiers will follow instructions from lane safety, load a magazine, and engage targets at 100 meters.

values: Firer will fire in safe directions and will be monitored by lane safeties and RSO
Medic will be present at all times on the range.
Targets will be placed between range fans and all targets will be de-conflicted with SDZ
All firers will be qualified on their weapons systems
Lane safeties will ensure safe firing and movement techniques
Soldiers will complete a blank iteration prior to live fire, day and night
Range RSO will conduct AXP and HLZ full dress rehearsal prior to range going hot
- Safety Supervision - Safety clears weapon before leaving firing area - Leadership will ensure no firing in maneuver lanes/shifts and lifts through verbal and visual communication
OIC, NCOIC, RSO, Lane Safeties, training population
Soldiers wear Full Dragoon Standard during execution.
Leaders continuously monitor Soldiers during execution to ensure proper shooting fundamentals.
Soldiers have been taught proper handling of weapons systems.
Soldiers will not handle or fire weapons systems with which they are untrained.
Ammo Point will fully separate all types of ammunition, spent, live, and different DODIC
When switching between iterations, Leadership and the ammo point NCO will confirm correct ammunition type for that segment of the range.
There will be no mixing of live and blank ammunition when issued to training Soldiers.
Weapons will always be pointed in a safe direction
Lane safeties will verify weapons are clear before clearing Squad off the lane
-Safety Brief, CONOP, Training Plan, PCC/PCI - Lane safeties check all ammo prior to execution

subtasks.hazard: Improper Use of Weapons Systems and Lasers

values: All Soldiers will be trained and qualified prior to range
All weapons will remain oriented in a safe direction.
Lasers will only be used while actively engaging targets.
Safety Brief, SOPs
OIC, safeties, training population
Range will cease fire if wildlife is on the range or if a fire erupts on the training range and will not go wet until all wildlife/fire has been cleared from range.
Any Soldier that spots wildlife or a fire will call the range to cease fire.
In the case of fire, range control will be called when prompted by the range meister to keep them abreast of the situation.
Fire fighting detail will remain ready with all PPE in the case that they must be deployed to retard fire.

subtasks.hazard: Tactical Vehicle maneuvering IVO of Dismounts

values: Soldiers will adhere to all speed limits when operating around GTA. Speed will be reduced during hours of limited visibility
Maximum of 5mph if operating within 8 meters of dismounted troops or with a ground guide.
Vehicle movement formations maintain safe and proper following distances.
All Soldiers inside of a tactical vehicle will either be seated in a designated seating platform with a seatbelt, or standing with a restraint harness.
Soldiers will be no higher than name-tape defilade if standing/outside of vehicle while it is moving.
Leaders deliver a convoy brief IAW TACSOP and understand the real world casualty evacuation plan and brief subordinates accordingly.
Soldiers will sleep only in designated areas IAW War Eagle SOP.
All vehicles will have licensed drivers, certified to drive at night, posess a valid 5988 and dispatch
PCC/PCI, Safety Brief, CONOP, Roll-over Drills, Rehearsals, Concept of Medical Support

subtasks.hazard: Improper handling of ammunition or explosives

values: Leaders ensure individuals who handle ammunition and pyrotechnics are trained on proper handling procedures and safety.
Soldiers must handle all ammunition with care.
Soldiers must wear eye protection and gloves while handing pyrotechnics, ammunition and crating/packaging material.
Leaders must enforce no smoking except in designated areas.
Have two ten (10) pound fire extinguisher(s) on hand at ammo point.
Separate blank/live DODICs by placement on separate pads
Ammo shakedown will be conducted after every iteration to ensure all ammunition is accounted for and only the proper ammunition is used for the following iteration
All Soldiers will be trained on the use of pyrotechnics prior to use
TACSOP, AR 385-64, DA PAM 385-64, AER 385-64, Risk reduction briefings, Leader Involvement. All Ammo Handlers Certified. AR/DA PAM 385-63/64 , Applicable FM/TM, or Accompanying Instructions
Ammunition NCO and Ammunition Detail
Leaders will adhere to GTA UXO procedures IAW with Range SOP.
Notify the Range Control Firing Desk upon discovery or creation. Mark grid location and halt training if it poses a direct threat to Soldiers.
